author: Stephanie Ortiz
text: 'La Casa is by far our favorite restaurant in Hoboken. It‚Äôs like my grandmas cooking but healthier and delicious (don‚Äôt tell abuela). After a few years of obsessing over la casa
column5: both friends and family also love the restaurant. Either ordering out or enjoying the hole in the wall quaint feeling in person. This weekend we asked la casa to cater our rehearsal dinner
column6: everyone was so excited and la casa delivered above and beyond. Even with 2 hrs of traveling with the food it tasted so fresh and delicious. We ordered everything from rice
column7: yuca
column8: croquettas
column9: pernil but the ropa vejia and cubanos won many people‚Äôs hearts. The coconut cake and guava cheesecake left within seconds too. Thank you la casa for making the start of the wedding weekend unforgettable for us. We knew our stomachs would be happy and ready for the next day. Highly recommend la casa for a dinner night or event. Alan was amazing to work with!!'

author: followJTusa JT USA
text: "(Hoboken.jan). Latin Food that tastes homecooked? La Casa at 54 Newark street offers you a taste of the most tender Rabo Encidido
column5: oxtail that is not just an exclusively Latin dish but is a also a universal favorite enjoyed by meat lovers from Africa to the Pacific. Peeking at you from a hot cabinet or food warmer are a variety of Empanadas
column6: Croquetas
column7: and Papa Rellena that can be seen from outside through the glass window. They even offer Guava and cheese empanadas - which I'm dying to try. My fave so far is the Spinach and Cheese. There's Beef (carne with olives) and Chicken (Pollo). The empanadas taste fresh and are made in-house. It is easy to miss the tiny door that leads to a cozy and intimate atmosphere. The menu offerings include standard Latin favorites such as Chicken
column8: Chorizos
column9: Beef and sides that include Beans
column13: they have it in what seems to be small place. BTW
column14: let's not forget that a good meal is not complete without dessert!  The bar displays a coconut cake or a chocolate enclosed in a glass stand. Coffee is served here. The Weekday Specials have entrees that come with 2 sides
column15: a tradition followed by most Spanish restaurants. Generous portions of sides are your choice of: Arroz Moro for me; Arroz Amarillo
column16: etc. Sandwiches are also offered. And Brunch on week-ennds startvearlty. Check for schedules and changes due to changing COVID protocols. Make sure you say
column17: easy on the salt please! (At least for me)."

author: Devante Phillip
text: "**DO NOT EAT AT THIS RESTAURANT**\n\nAfter eating with my family to celebrate an early Mother's Day celebration

author: Lynnette Medrano
text: "I had no choice but to leave one star
column5: I would have left none
column6: I should have thoroughly read the reviews as the common denominator in them is about customer service and forgetting orders. It is Thanksgiving day and because things are different this year
column7: we decided to do a catering order with La Casa. We placed an order on November 4 with a follow up confirmation about a week later for pick up; payment was also made on Nov 4.\nToday
column8: we arrive to pick up our order and we are met with closed doors and a sign stating the restaurant has not been open since Nov 21. During times like these
column9: it is alarming to know that this restaurant couldn't give us a phone call to cancel the order. Moreover
column10: you would think there are protocols in place and the fact that this was completely overlooked makes me wonder what other simpler tasks may be falling by the waistline. I was informed that the owner of this restaurant is the same one as the pizzeria establishment in the corner (across from CVS). I visited both locations this morning as none of the workers were able to provide me with contact information for a supervisor
column11: and further did not have it themselves. Whether or not they were trying to occult this information is fine
column12: but someone could have at least reached out internally for further guidance. Its unfortunate their workers were like me
column13: with no information and also frustrated on my behalf.\n\nDo better La Casa
column14: for those who may count on you in the future while trying to create memories during these taxing times. I will never place an order with this restaurant and I would recommend to think twice if you're considering catering."

text: "Me & My wife came here a year ago. Couldn't wait to go back because food was so good...& Affordable. But my chicken was not...with that said I would still come back. Would prob just send meal back & start over instead of forcing it."

author: Jessi Aiello
text: 'Cute cozy spot.. went in sunday with a party of 8..We were coming from out of state so we did not realize how tiny it was. Once we walked in we realized and were going to just order it to go  because we didn‚Äôt think we would fit. The owner and the wait staff were super nice and accommodating and basically rearranged the entire area just to fit us .  They came over and talked to us and we‚Äôre very patient even though we had three kids with us.... Great selection and food was delicious‚Ä¶ Next time we go to Jersey we will be back. Loved the Decor'

text: "Pssssst amazing foods like family recipes! I came there first to pickup the Fresh Empanada

author: Diana Jin
text: 'Great service and ambiance to start. All of the appetizers are terrific

column8: so we ordered a side of the fried yucca. For dessert

author: Gillibee
text: 'Very tasty food at affordable prices. A cute and cozy atmosphere. There are several dishes that are only available certain days of the week which is kinda annoying.'

author: Azy Brown
text: "My husband and I came here on a whim for brunch
column5: and LOVED IT. The music and ambience takes you away from the city; the staff is extremely nice; and the food was amazing. We left here on a high!\n\nWe ordered the chorizo tapas as an appetizer
column6: which was cooked to perfection (full of flavor
column7: and not oily) and was accompanied by carmelized onions. It was a generous portion; if we came for dinner
column8: I'd order this with another tapas and be full.\n\nI ordered the La Casa Eggs Benedict. It came with a side of cuban sausage and amazing garlic bread. As a eggs-benedict addict
column9:
I thought it was well done.

My husband was pleased to see they had a selection of Mofungos; he ordered the one with pork. He ate 1/8 of it and was stuffed - he took the rest home.

We also ordered cafe con leches
column10: and were on our way for $40ish total."

author: Stephen Antisz
text: 'Amazing food.'

text: 'This place has the absolute worst delivery fee policy I have ever heard off. They charge $10 once the bill is over $100. Makes absolutely no sense'

text: 'Great

author: Joel Rodriguez
text: 'Food was amazing great Service and fast.. the food flavor is beyond good. We drove from Pennsylvania to eat there and will go again is that great... recommend everyone to go try it.. you will not regret it..'

author: Melanie Tam
text: "Came in on a Saturday at around 5. La Casa is pretty small (and narrow)
column5: but there weren't too many people dining there - probably because it was a weird time.\n\nTo start
column6: we had the chicken empanada
column7: spinach/cheese empanada
column8: and the ham croquette. The empanadas were only okay. They didn't seem too fresh
column9: especially since they took them out of one of those food heaters
column10: but they weren't terrible. The croquette was pretty good.\n\nFor my main
column11: I had the cuban sandwich. This would have been really good
column12: had they not drenched the bread in butter. I was able to smell all the butter as our waiter was walking towards us with the plate. BF had some kind of pork plate
column13: which comes with two sides so he opted for rice and french fries. For all of this food
column15: which includes tax and tip. Pretty great deal. I'd come back and try some of their other sandwiches but next time
column16: I'll tell them to go easy on the butter."

author: Magleny Del Valle Cardona
text: 'The mofongo with pernil was AMAZING great service and place. Rice with Beans and Bistec was AMAZING too highly recommend!!'

author: Jose Nunez
text: 'OMG loved the food
column5: the ambiance and the whole crew! Russell you are the best!!! Allen and the rest of the guys. Really appreciated the hospitality.'

author: Liney Quintero
text: 'Best place!!! Love it'

author: Frank
text: 'Small inside sitting area but
column5: the food makes up for it...delicious!!'

author: Tatiana Ahonsi
text: 'Was served old rice that was sticking together the food tasted like salt was added to cover the refrigerated taste my friends tasted and also realized the food I was served was not fresh and the owner was very rude.'

author: Ahkirah Brundidge
text: 'I literally lived in this place when I worked in Hoboken. The chicharron with garlic sauce is AMAZING it made me feel like I was back in the south Bronx & the owner is so nice! He‚Äôs always welcoming & the staff are also super nice. This is my #1 place to eat in Hoboken hands down!'

author: John Zube
text: 'Empanadas are awesome!'

author: Mike DiMaria
text: 'Authentic Spanish food! I say this having grown up in a house with a Puerto Rican mom making many of these same dishes. Highly recommended!'

author: Eliecer Espinoza
text: 'Good food and tasty'

author: Jordelin Lopez
text: "Food is amazing &  price is amazing. La Casa is the perfect name for this place because the food taste homemade & delicious. I'm Spanish so I'm not too fond of Spanish food places but La Casa skyrockets my expectations. It's like my mom cooked for me."

author: Jared Banyard
text: "Amazing Mofongo. Bring your own booze
column5: but you won't have time to drink it between the delicious mouthfuls."

author: Joe Boucher
text: "Can't beat the quality for the price"

author: Glenn Eagan
text: 'The food is like eating at home! F in FANTASTIC!'

author: Andres Vidal
text: 'Excellent food and the price is just right for the area. Some of the staff are really nice! My go-to place for lunch!'

author: Jordan Silva
text: 'Very flavorful and delicious foods

author: Ralf C
text: 'The food was good. It was a bit crowded and hectic but i would go back.'

author: Kisha B
text: 'Great service and the food was amazing!!! Extremely affordable and large portions. I had the red snapper with rice and plantains.'

author: Lexi Cendan
text: "La Casa truly makes you feel like you're at home! With their authentic Spanish cuisine
column5: friendly employees
column6: outstanding prices
column7: and fun atmosphere
column8: you will be left wanting more! Nothing beats this restaurant."

author: Lourdes Garcia
text: 'This place is disgusting. I had a roach in my beans and a piece of black hair in my rice. No my hair is not black. It‚Äôs actually blonde
column5: so don‚Äôt try and point fingers and say it was my own. Plus
column6: the Spanish speaking lady barely understood what I was telling her. I will never return here again. Dirty place. God knows what happens in that kitchen. NEVER GO HERE!!'

author: Kris Turgeau
text: 'The food is good but the pernil is salty.'

author: John NYC
text:
"Pros
1. Beef Empanadas are the Best in New Jersey and New York City. (I have a Suggested what about Shredded Beef Empanadas and call them Ropa Vieja Empanadas)
2. The Yuca with Garlic is So Tender.
3. The Chicken Stew is Dominican Style so No Carrots or Potatoes.... :( Pero
column5:
Still Hella Good! #goDRPRfoooood
4. The Oxtail Stew was Flavorful and Tender.
5. The Rice is Cooked Well.
6. The Ambience is Cozy when I walk in I feel like I'm on Vacation in Puerto Rico or Dominican Republic.

Cons
1. The Sancocho Soup was good but I'm not a fan of Cerdo (Pork) Sancocho Soup. I expected Oxtails thrown in the Sabroso Fun. ;)
2. No Alcapurrias.... #mouthdropped ha ha
3. The Chicken Empanadas needs more Flavor
column6:
maybe extra Sofrito or Recaito. (The Beef Empanada took me to Abuela's House pero el Chicken took me to the Bodega.)

I can't wait to try their Mangu and Bistec....

Overall
column7: Great Puerto Rican/Dominican Restaurant. We cook better than Cubans. #handsdown. I hope they do a Cuchifrito Station at the Jersey City Puertorican Festival in the future."

author: Angel Gomez
text: "The sandwiches are great and freshly prepared.  The food is okay but not prepared Cuban style.  What's up with the color of the red bean soup?"

author: Arjun Antony
text: 'Great ambience and amazing food! Had some tasty melt-in-your-mouth pork here.  A note
column5: if you order a side of fries
column6: be prepared for a large plate loaded with it!'

author: Elba Rosario
text: 'Great Spanish music..great service and great\nSpanish food..seating inside and outside as well..Had the sancocho and a meat enpanada..Yummm..love this place..'

author: avothello
text: "The absolute best mofongo I've had outside of Puerto Rico. Great people
column5: great service and awesome food."

author: Ale Hernandez
text: "Great service
column5: great place
column6: great music and I loved the food. It's quite similar to the honduran cuisine
column7: I had some ropa vieja and it was really good. It was a pleasant experience."

author: Mawel Soler
text: 'Perfect combination of the 3 Latino island cuisine. Tasty & Very affordable for this area. Best of all BYOB. A must try.'

author: Flux Capacitor
text: 'Hands down
column5: best Ox Tail Stew in Hoboken. Food is fresh and well made.\n\nThe Ox Tail title use to be owned by Isla Restaurant.  La Casa always has Ox Tail unlike Isla; a two day weekly special for them
column6: and both days they are always "sold out" before noon.'

author: iris anderson
text: 'The food was superb the service was great I really enjoyed nice place in Hoboken. And the prices are just right because Hoboken can be overpriced especially the cookie house right next door to the restaurant'

author: Mehrdad Nosrati
text: 'Excellent service and delicious food! This is a cozy place close to Hoboken terminal. The staff were super nice and friendly. Their food portion is much more than enough for a person. The food quality was good and the price is really fair. It gets busy at weekends. If you go there on Friday night or Saturday evening
column5: expect 15-20 minuets delay.'

author: Ipshita Chakraborty
text: 'Amazing food! Loved their beef croquettes and beef stew. Very chill place with friendly servers.'

author: Anthony Cordero
text: "Great little nook in Hoboken. Great people and great cuban-latin food. One of Hoboken's hidden Gems. Highly recommend this place. The owner personally helped us out and was more than friendly."

text: 'Reasonable prices and delicious!'

text: 'So delicious'
